clinical_study.brief_title: Assessment of the Transferability of Skills From Robotic to Laparoscopic Simulation Platforms
clinical_study.official_title: Assessment of the Transferability of Skills From Robotic to Laparoscopic Simulation Platforms in Surgical Skill Naive Participants

brief_summary.textblock: This is a randomized controlled trial that will randomize 40 surgical skill naive medical students to practice on a robotic simulator or laparoscopic simulator after first completing a baseline evaluation on both surgical simulation platforms. Medical students will be evaluated again after 10 practice sessions on the laparoscopic or robotic platforms to assess transferability of skills between the surgical simulation platforms.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a randomized controlled trial that will randomize medical students to practice on a robotic simulator or a laparoscopic simulator. The investigators will first obtain baseline data by having the study participants perform one task (peg transfer exercise) on a laparoscopic simulator (Fundamentals of Laparoscopic Surgery (FLS), VT Medical Inc, Waltham, MA), and a similar task on a robotic trainer (Mimic da Vinci Simulator, Intuitive Surgical, Sunnyvale, CA). Participants will then be randomized to practice on the robotic simulator or practice on the laparoscopic trainer for at least 10 repetitions or until proficient as determined by pre-set standards from FLS simulator and Mimic simulator. After the participants complete 10 repetitions, they will be evaluated again on both the laparoscopic and robotic simulator. Within 4 weeks of practice completion, both groups will perform the above tasks on the robotic simulator and the laparoscopic simulator. In addition to capturing standard parameters such as time to completion and number of errors, we will capture motion metrics from the Mimic simulator. Two expert laparoscopic and robotic surgeons will also evaluate participant performance using previously validated global rating scales for robotic and laparoscopic surgery.

primary_outcome.description: Primary outcome will be pass/fail criteria predetermined on the Mimic robotic trainer and FLS training standards. We will capture motion metrics from both the actual robotic console as well as from the Mimic simulator.

secondary_outcome.measure: Validated Laparoscopic and Robotic Reznick scale
secondary_outcome.description: Two expert laparoscopic and robotic surgeons will evaluate participant performance using previously validated global rating scales for robotic and laparoscopic surgery.

20 study participants will be randomized to perform peg board 1 exercise 10 times on a Mimic da Vinci robotic simulator (Mimic da Vinci Simulator, Intuitive Surgical, Sunnyvale, CA).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Medical students with no prior laparoscopic or robotic experience in clinical or practice setting
Exclusion Criteria:
- Prior laparoscopic or robotic experience in clinical setting or in practice setting
